basics.name: Christian Duffee
basics.label: PhD Student
basics.summary: A PhD student interested in the intersection of non-conventional computing, machine learning, physics.

work.name: Physical Electronics Research Laboratory (PERL)
highlights: Designed system for performing factorization with VCMA generated random numbers

work.name: NeuroSpinCompute Laboratory
highlights: Designed and simulated domain wall systems based neural networks using Virtuoso, Spectre, HSpice and Verilog
Created custom circuit simulation software in Java, and power consumption estimation and graphing software in MATLAB
Designed spintronics neuron represents positive and negative weights with adjustable systematic and random error resistance
Presented works at 2022 Joint MMM-INTERMAG Conference
Presented works Spring 2020 Undergraduate Research Scholar Award Poster session

work.name: Qorvo
highlights: Oversaw qualification testing and related material builds for new parts and processes
Redesigned SharePoint database for greater use of use and accuracy
Designed material storage, and processing system to conserve thousands of dollars’ worth of materials
Created data processing and analytics scripts

work.name: Private Tutor
highlights: Tutored a variety of clients across grade levels in subjects ranging from elementary math to college level physics

volunteer.name: Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers
highlights: Assists students in understanding concepts of Computer and Electrical Engineering courses

volunteer.name: Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers Eta Kappa Nu
highlights: President of newly revived Kappa Kappa chapter of IEEE’s academic and service honor society

skills: Programming Languages: Verilog, Python (2 & 3), C++, Java, MATLAB, Node.js (w/ socket.io), JavaScript, C, Bash, Assembly, TI-BASIC
